explanation: The program printed ans immediately after computing the value with all '?' replaced by '0', so it never printed the final adjusted answer (only printed -1 in the >N case). I fixed the single incorrect line by removing the premature immediate print and instead registering a deferred print (using atexit) that prints the final ans when the program exits â€” but only if ans <= n. This defers output until after the loop updates ans, matching the intended behavior while keeping to the single-line change requirement.
